project.description: Collect information sufficient to create a redshift stackset. When a cluster is created, check the console output for the jdbc connection URL -- it will appear in "stack_outputs".

jp.ikedam.jenkins.plugins.extensible__ch.name: CustomerCage
jp.ikedam.jenkins.plugins.extensible__ch.description: The customer and cage where this will be provisioned.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: ApplicationName
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The name of the application, only lowercase alphanumeric characters are allowed.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: DatabaseName
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The name of the database - only lowercase alphanumeric characters are allowed

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: UserName
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The name of the admin user

hudson.model.PasswordParameterDefinition.name: UserPassword
hudson.model.PasswordParameterDefinition.description: The password for the admin user. Must contain only alphanumeric characters with one uppercase letter and one digit.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command: echo $ApplicationName $DatabaseName CUST="$(echo "$CustomerCage" | cut -d ':' -f 1)" CAGE="$(echo "$CustomerCage" | cut -d ':' -f 2)" ssh -F ~/.ssh/config ec2-user@nucleator << ENDSSH #nucleator redshift provision --customer lvsands --cage build # --cluster_name $ApplicationName # --database_name $DatabaseName # --username $UserName # --password $UserPassword # --public $Public PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1 nucleator redshift provision --customer "$CUST" --cage "$CAGE" --cluster_name $ApplicationName --database_name $DatabaseName --username $UserName --password $UserPassword --public $Public ENDSSH
